events.originalText: A gas leak underneath the Pemex Executive Tower in Mexico City caused an explosion that killed at least 37 people and injured another 121.
events.subtitle: Torre Ejecutiva Pemex
events.headline: Gas leak explosion at Pemex Executive Tower in Mexico City kills 37

events.originalText: James Cameron's Avatar became the first film to earn over US$2 billion worldwide.
events.subtitle: James Cameron
events.headline: James Cameron's Avatar surpasses US$2 billion worldwide

events.originalText: Emergency officials in Boston mistakenly identified LED placards depicting characters from Aqua Teen Hunger Force as IEDs, causing a panic.
events.subtitle: Aqua Teen Hunger Force
events.headline: Boston emergency officials mistake LED placards for IEDs, causing panic

events.originalText: Alaska Airlines Flight 261, experiencing problems with its horizontal stabilizer system, crashed in the Pacific Ocean off Anacapa Island, California, killing all 88 people on board.
events.subtitle: Alaska Airlines Flight 261
events.headline: Alaska Airlines Flight 261 crashes off Anacapa Island, California, killing 88

events.originalText: Final Fantasy VII, the first video game in the Final Fantasy franchise to use 3-D computer graphics, was released.
events.subtitle: Final Fantasy VII
events.headline: Final Fantasy VII released with 3-D computer graphics

events.originalText: Doug Williams (pictured) became the first African-American quarterback to play in a Super Bowl, leading the Washington Redskins to victory in Super Bowl XXII.
events.subtitle: Doug Williams (quarterback)
events.headline: Doug Williams leads Washington Redskins to victory in Super Bowl XXII

events.originalText: Aboard NASA's Mercury-Redstone 2, Ham the Chimp became the first hominid launched into outer space.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: Ham the Chimp launched into outer space aboard NASA's Mercury-Redstone 2

events.originalText: A DC-7B operated by Douglas Aircraft collided in mid-air with a U.S. Air Force F-89 and crashed into a schoolyard in Pacoima, California.
events.subtitle: Douglas DC-7
events.headline: DC-7B collides with U.S. Air Force F-89, crashes in Pacoima, California

events.originalText: Intense rioting over labour conditions broke out in Glasgow, Scotland.
events.subtitle: Battle of George Square
events.headline: Rioting over labour conditions erupts in Glasgow, Scotland

events.originalText: Datu Muhammad Salleh, leader of a series of major disturbances in North Borneo, was shot dead in Tambunan, but his followers did not give up for five more years.
events.subtitle: Mat Salleh Rebellion
events.headline: Leader of North Borneo disturbances, Datu Muhammad Salleh, shot dead in Tambunan

events.originalText: The London Lock Hospital, the first voluntary hospital specialising in the treatment of venereal diseases, opened.
events.subtitle: London Lock Hospital
events.headline: London Lock Hospital, specializing in venereal disease treatment, opens

events.originalText: Eighty Years' War: Spain won a crushing victory at the Battle of Gembloux, threatening the States General of the Netherlands and contributing to its move from Brussels to Antwerp.
events.subtitle: Eighty Years' War
events.headline: Spain wins Battle of Gembloux, threatening States General of the Netherlands

events.originalText: King Sverker II of Sweden was defeated at the Battle of Lena by Eric Knutsson, who succeeded to the throne.
events.subtitle: Sverker II of Sweden
events.headline: King Sverker II of Sweden defeated at Battle of Lena by Eric Knutsson

events.originalText: Sylvester I (bust depicted), during whose pontificate many churches in Rome were constructed by Constantine the Great, began his reign as pope.
events.subtitle: Pope Sylvester I
events.headline: Pope Sylvester I begins reign with construction of churches in Rome
